speaker: Outstanding Guest Actress in a Comedy Series
text: Patti LuPone
nextSpeaker: Outstanding Sound Mixing for a Comedy Series or Special

speaker: Outstanding Sound Mixing for a Comedy Series or Special
text: Thomas J. Huth, Andre Caporaso, Robert Douglass, Dana Mark McClure  * * *  ## Transcript {mike lee}    _ACT ONE  Scene One -- KACL. Frasier is wrapping up his show. _
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Guest Actress in a Comedy Series

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's all the time we have for this afternoon, Seattle. This is Dr. Frasier Crane, wishing you good afternoon, and good mental health. _He goes off the air and starts gathering his things into his briefcase. Roz comes into his booth._
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Sound Mixing for a Comedy Series or Special

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, if I ask your opinion about something, will you give me an honest answer and not just tell me what you think I want to hear?

speaker: Frasier
text: Absolutely, Roz.  Anytime, all you have to do is ask. _Behind his back, Roz puts on a new hat.  Frasier turns around, looks -- and heads for the door. _

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, I knew it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no, no, Roz, I'm just kidding.  I love it!

speaker: Roz
text: Really?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it looks great.

speaker: Roz
text: Are you sure?

speaker: Frasier
text: Trust me.

speaker: Roz
text: OK.  It's just in my condition I'm just a little insecure. You know, every time I see something cute in the window, I remember how I look and I think, "no way." _A handsome, dark-haired young man appears in the glass, sees Frasier, and knocks, grinning._

speaker: Roz
text: Here we go again.

speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh, that's my cousin!  Nikos!  What are you doing here?

speaker: Nikos
text: [_coming through the door_] I was in the neighborhood, I thought I'd stop by!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, it's great to see you!  My God, it's been ages.  Oh yes, I'd like you to meet my producer, Roz Doyle.

speaker: Roz
text: [_shaking hands_] Hi.

speaker: Frasier
text: This is Nikos, my father's brother's son.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I would have never pegged you for a Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, he's half Greek.  He gets his looks from his mom.

speaker: Roz
text: I'll bet he gets looks from lots of women.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz!

speaker: Nikos
text: It's nice to meet you.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, you too.  You know, I never knew Frasier had a cousin.

speaker: Nikos
text: I think he's ashamed of me.  Why else would he turn down an invitation to my wedding?

speaker: Frasier
text: You're getting married?

speaker: Nikos
text: Yeah, on Saturday.  Don't tell me you didn't get the invitation.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, no, it's the first I'm hearing of it!

speaker: Nikos
text: I knew it.  I knew Mom wasn't telling the truth.  She said she never heard back from you.

speaker: Frasier
text: She must still be nursing that grudge.

speaker: Roz
text: Uh-oh, this sounds like, you know, personal, private, family stuff. [_sits in Frasier's chair and puts her feet up_] So, what's this grudge you're talking about?

speaker: Nikos
text: Oh, it's all so silly.  Mom has never forgiven Frasier for some career advice he gave me.  And, trust me, he saved me from going down the wrong path.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, thank you, Nikos.  Well, I'd certainly hate to miss this wedding.  I wonder if there's some way we could work this out. You want to go grab a cup of coffee?

speaker: Nikos
text: Sure.

speaker: Frasier
text: Great!

speaker: Roz
text: So, what was the wrong path?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz, it's rather a long story--

speaker: Nikos
text: My folks wanted me to go to medical school.

speaker: Roz
text: Ah, so what path did you choose instead?

speaker: Frasier
text: We don't really have the time to into all that right now--

speaker: Nikos
text: I became a juggler.  I perform on street corners.

speaker: Roz
text: Ah, I see.  And all because of his advice.  Tell me, do people sometimes toss you coins?

speaker: Nikos
text: Sure, lots of times.

speaker: Roz
text: [_handing him her hat_] Well, here's something you can catch them in. _FADE OUT  Scene Two -- Apartment Frasier has just delivered the news to Martin, who is having his blood pressure taken by Daphne.  Niles is pouring himself sherry. _

speaker: Martin
text: You and your damned advice!

speaker: Daphne
text: Mr. Crane, Dr. Rudnik asked me to monitor your blood pressure, and I'd like to get an accurate reading.

speaker: Frasier
text: Stop pointing fingers.  Why don't we try to solve this problem?

speaker: Martin
text: I don't see how!  She's a vindictive woman, and she's gonna keep on punishing us because of you!  If you kept your big trap shut for just once in your life, my nephew would probably be a surgeon now, and I'd be going to his wedding!

speaker: Daphne
text: There, now -- 240 over 11.  Sounds about right!

speaker: Niles
text: Personally, I'd have loved to have gone, but this is clearly a snub and we Crane men have our pride.  Right, Dad?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, stop it, Niles!  You're just afraid of seeing Cousin Yvonne, aren't you?

speaker: Daphne
text: Who's Cousin Yvonne?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, a distant cousin who has a slight crush on Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: "A slight crush?"  There are cannibals who are less man- hungry.

speaker: Daphne
text: That's funny, I've always thought it would be kind of romantic to have a secret admirer, someone who longed for me that much. But I do see your point, Dr. Crane.  When you think about it, it is kind of sick.

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah, well, perhaps "sick" is a tad judgmental.

speaker: Martin
text: I can't believe that because of your big mouth, Zora won't even let me in her restaurant!

speaker: Frasier
text: Forcing you to go elsewhere when you have one of your frequent cravings for stuffed grape leaves and zither music!

speaker: Niles
text: It's a moot point.  We're not invited, thanks to Frasier's more-than-usually inept advice.

speaker: Martin
text: Can you imagine what it's like to live in the same city as your brother, and not see him for five years?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, but I'd like to give it a try.  Dad, I think that we should go to this wedding.

speaker: Martin
text: Forget it, Zora doesn't want us there.

speaker: Frasier
text: But Nikos wants us there!  My God, I watched that boy grow up! I want to be there when he gets married!

speaker: Daphne
text: I'd like to venture an opinion here.  I know this doesn't exactly concern me, but I feel very strongly about this. I like zither music, and I always have!

speaker: Frasier
text: And we're back!  Listen, Dad--

speaker: Martin
text: No, drop it, Frasier.  If my brother's wife doesn't see fit to invite me, I am not just going to show up.

speaker: Niles
text: End of story, case closed, that's all she wrote!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, stop it, Niles.  There are more important issues at stake here than you being mauled by Yvonne the Terrible!  Dad is hurt, can't you see that?  He misses his brother.  Well, it's my fault, and I'm going to put it right. [_picks up the phone and dials_] I'm going to get in touch with Aunt Zora.  Surely she'll listen to reason. [_into phone_] Aunt Zora? [_she hangs up_] Well, that's encouraging.  She remembered my voice.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, just give up.

speaker: Frasier
text: No!  She can't avoid me if I go down and meet her face-to- face. [_gets his coat_] I'm going to go to that restaurant.

speaker: Niles
text: Do you have a death wish?  She'll eat you alive!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'm not afraid of her!

speaker: Niles
text: Everyone is!  Have you forgotten the family legend that when Hitler invaded Greece she joined the partisans just so she could strangle Nazis?

speaker: Frasier
text: I have never believed that.  She would have to have been five years old at the time!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, that's why the legend says they were strangled with jump ropes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Stop it! _They go out the door.  FADE TO:_ **WELCOME TO HELL'S KITCHEN** _Scene Three -- Kitchen. The restaurant's kitchen, bustling with activity.  At the center is Zora -- a short, muscular Greek woman -- tenderizing a steak with a mallet.  A waiter comes in. _

speaker: Zora
text: Dmitri, pick up your order, don't make me hurt you again! _Dmitri grabs a waiting tray and scuttles out, terrified.  Frasier comes in.  Zora sees him -- and redoubles her assault on the steak, pounding the stuffing out of it.  Frasier turns and runs, then steels his courage and comes back in. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Aunt Zora, I realize I'm not the most welcome person here, but--

speaker: Frasier
text: It is not fair to take my mistake out on your husband, or my father! _Zora ignores him and walks around the kitchen, issuing orders to the cooks.  Frasier follows her, weaving through the maze of tables and counters._

speaker: Frasier
text: They didn't do anything!

speaker: Zora
text: [_tasting a dish_] More pepper!

speaker: Frasier
text: You have a wedding coming up, you should be joyous!

speaker: Zora
text: Sponge off this countertop!

speaker: Frasier
text: Nikos tells me his fiancee's a lovely young woman from a wealthy family, that you like her very much!

speaker: Zora
text: Mop up this slop!

speaker: Frasier
text: So your heart should be brimming with motherly emotions!

speaker: Zora
text: [_picks up a bent skewer_] When I find out who bent this skewer, I'm ramming it right in his eye!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_trying to lighten the moment_] You know, I've always wanted to do this: make a trip around the Greek Islands! _One of the cooks laughs.  Zora gives him a vicious slap.  Then she picks up a meat cleaver and starts slicing a steak on a cutting board._

speaker: Frasier
text: Aunt Zora, my point is that we are family, and we should be together.  And I promise that if you invite us to this wedding, I will never give Nikos another piece of advice for as long as I live.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm through meddling, you have my word.  And if you do invite us to the wedding, I also promise that I'll promote this wonderful, wonderful restaurant of yours on my radio program.

speaker: Frasier
text: Every day for a... month?

speaker: Zora
text: [_joyous_] Frasier! [_throws her arms around him_]

speaker: Frasier
text: You forgive me!

speaker: Zora
text: Of course, of course!  And you don't just come to the wedding! You come to the rehearsal dinner too!  Tomorrow night, right here, because we are family!  Here, eat! _She grabs a spoonful of something from a pot and shoves it in his mouth.  The taste is enough to make him gag, but he converts his wince into an emotive grimace._

speaker: Zora
text: My very special _kokaretski_ , for a very special nephew! Oh God, I'm such a softie!  I'll be crying in a minute!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_mouth still full_] Me, too! _END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO_ **LORD OF THE DANCE** _Scene Four -- Restaurant The rehearsal party is in full swing, packed with guests.  A bouzouki plays in the corner, and some people are dancing.  Frasier comes in, followed by a very tightly-wound Niles. _

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I hope you enjoy yourself, Mr. Blessed-Are-the- Peacemakers!

speaker: Frasier
text: Will you stop complaining?  The rehearsal went beautifully. Cousin Yvonne didn't even get near you.

speaker: Niles
text: How could she?  I spent half the time hiding in the confessional!  By the way, Mrs. Pappas is having an affair. _Zora comes over, followed by Martin's younger brother Ed with a video camera._

speaker: Zora
text: There they are, my two favorite nephews! [_hugs them_] Ed, get me with the boys! [_poses with them_] You know, I am so glad you are coming to the wedding tomorrow.  There is nothing sadder than a divided family, am I right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Quite right.

speaker: Niles
text: Absolutely, absolutely.  When Frasier told me we weren't invited to the wedding, I--

speaker: Yvonne
text: There you are, Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: Just kill me now. _Yvonne -- a powerfully-built, curly-haired woman in a tight blue dress that shows off her ample cleavage -- attaches herself to Niles's arm. _

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Yvonne.

speaker: Yvonne
text: I haven't seen you two in a long time!

speaker: Niles
text: [_eyes on her bosom_] Oh well, I haven't seen your two in a long time -- "you, too," "you, too!"

speaker: Yvonne
text: Oh, well, we've got a lot of catching up to do.  Let's go get us a glass of bubbly!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you know, I don't think so--

speaker: Zora
text: Oh, go on, enjoy!  it's none of that sissy French wine, it's real Greek champagne!

speaker: Frasier
text: Ooh, save some for me Niles!  [_N.B. A note for wine snobs: "champagne" properly refers only to the variety of sparkling wine produced in Champagne, France.  Thus, true Champagne is a sparkling or "bubbly" wine, but not all sparkling/bubbly wines are Champagne.  In fact, it is illegal in France for any sparkling wine produced outside Champagne to be called "champagne," or to even have the word anywhere on its label.  The French also insist that this rule be followed by the members of the European Union, of which Greece is one.  They also boycott any foreign sparkling wines that use the word.  Although it is legal in the U.S. for winemakers to use the word, it is taken as a sign of class not to._] _Yvonne drags Niles away.  Frasier blends into the crowd.  Martin comes in with Daphne._

speaker: Zora
text: And here he is, my favorite brother-in-law!  Martin, it's been too long!

speaker: Martin
text: It sure has.  Say, where's Walt?  We got a lot of catching up to do.

speaker: Zora
text: Oh, don't worry, he'll be here. [_noticing Daphne_] Who is this pretty young thing?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, this is Daphne Moon.  She's my physical therapist.

speaker: Zora
text: Oh.  That's what they call it these days? [_slaps him playfully_] You dirty old man! _She shakes a fist and moves off laughing.  Martin tries to simultaneously correct her and mollify Daphne, who's saying "I've never been so insulted!" etc., etc.  In another corner, Nikos introduces a pretty young blond woman to Frasier._

speaker: Nikos
text: This is my fiancee, Mary-Ann Taubeneck.

speaker: Frasier
text: Mary-Ann, it's a pleasure.  Taubeneck?  As in the Taubeneck Building?

speaker: Mary-Ann
text: Yeah, and Taubeneck Park, etc., etc.  That was my grandfather, the original robber baron.

speaker: Nikos
text: Mary-Ann has some issues with her family. _Mary-Ann points to her parents, a well-dressed, middle-aged couple sitting at a table, whose disposition is definitely more funereal than matrimonial._

speaker: Mary-Ann
text: Look at them sulking over there.  You should have seen their faces when I told them I was marrying a street person.

speaker: Nikos
text: Performer.  Street performer.

speaker: Mary-Ann
text: Oh, right.  Anyway, they've got it coming after all the debutante nonsense they put me through. [_waves to someone_] Would you excuse me?

speaker: Nikos
text: Great, isn't she?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  How did you meet?

speaker: Nikos
text: A few months back, I performed at one of her parents' garden parties.  They were really snooty to me.  That seemed to spark something in her.  She asked me for a date right in front of them.  That's how she is.  She likes to play with her parents' heads.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, so did Lizzie Borden.

speaker: Nikos
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I can't help thinking that... nothing.  Just a bad joke. She seems like a lovely girl.

speaker: Nikos
text: Yeah, she really is.  My family adores her.  You should hear my mom, she thinks Crystal's the best thing that ever happened to me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Crystal?

speaker: Nikos
text: Did I say that?  I mean Mary-Ann.  I must have been admiring the beautiful crystal over there, that's why I called her crystal.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it's a good thing you weren't admiring the pork-butt!

speaker: Nikos
text: I'm so nervous these days, I don't know what I'm saying. I guess it's just a case of pre-wedding jitters, right?

speaker: Zora
text: Nikos, Nikos, go check on the sous-chef, make sure he isn't into the ouzo!

speaker: Zora
text: Last time, he drank until he got his head caught in the duck press.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, really?  How did he manage that?

speaker: Zora
text: [_friendly menace_] With my help.  So, what were you and Nikos talking about?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, now, now, now, Aunt Zora, don't you worry.  I made you a promise, and I'd die before I'd break it.

speaker: Zora
text: Or soon after.  So, you met Mary-Ann?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, lovely girl.  You must be very proud.

speaker: Zora
text: Oh, and relieved!  Do you know that crazy son of mine was going steady with a juggler for three years?  Crystal- somebody. [_Frasier's ears prick up_] Can you imagine having a daughter-in-law who throws things for a living?  It's embarrassing. _She looks around, decides she doesn't like the lull, and smashes two plates to the floor._

speaker: Zora
text: DANCE, people!  Let us celebrate tonight!

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Frasier, thanks for settling everything with Zora.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, it's my pleasure, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: But, you know, I can't find Walt.  I've been waiting five years for this reunion.

speaker: Frasier
text: Must be here somewhere.  Now, did you know that Nikos and Mary-Ann have only known each other for--

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, there he is! _

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, this is so exciting!  You two must have so much to talk about!  Uncle Walt, hello!

speaker: Walt
text: Frasier!  Marty...

speaker: Martin
text: Walt...

speaker: Walt
text: What's new?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, same-old, same-old.  How's tricks?

speaker: Walt
text: Eh, can't complain.  They keeping you busy?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, better believe it.

speaker: Walt
text: Well, what're you gonna do?

speaker: Martin
text: Tell me about it.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's amazing how you two can pick up right where you left off. _DISSOLVE TO: Later Frasier wanders over to a shelf of wine bottles.  Curious, he takes two down to check the labels -- revealing Niles's face hiding behind the shelf. _

speaker: Niles
text: Psst!  Put those back!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_noticing him_] Niles!  Do you realize how pathetic this is?

speaker: Niles
text: I don't care!  At dinner, Zora announced that I'd filed for divorce!  Within seconds, Yvonne began purring so loudly my allergies kicked in!  I won't be safe until this wedding is over!

speaker: Frasier
text: The wedding I'm beginning to think might just be a serious mistake.

speaker: Niles
text: Ooh, I like the sound of that.  Does this mean you're going to meddle and get us both thrown out?

speaker: Frasier
text: I can't!  I promised I wouldn't!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, dear God, here she comes again!

speaker: Yvonne
text: Hi, Frasier, have you seen Niles?

speaker: Frasier
text: Why, no, I haven't.

speaker: Yvonne
text: Oh! [_goes off again_] _DISSOLVE TO: Later Daphne is sitting alone.  Martin brings a plate of food over._

speaker: Martin
text: Here we go.

speaker: Daphne
text: How much longer do we have stay?

speaker: Martin
text: What are you in such a snit about?

speaker: Daphne
text: This lot.  Thanks to your sister-in-law they're all sniggering about me being your "physical therapist."

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, don't let it bother you.  She's always been a pain.

speaker: Daphne
text: You're telling me.  Dried-up old grape leaf!

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, and she's one to talk about reputations, too!  Between you and me, before she married my brother, she was easier to make than a peanut butter sandwich!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_laughs_] Does everyone know that?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, everybody except my brother.  I mean, I love him dearly, but he's not exactly the brightest bulb in the, uh...

speaker: Daphne
text: Bulb box?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.  Shh, here's Eddie! [_Ed comes over_] Hey, Eddie! Where's the camera?

speaker: Ed
text: Aha, then it worked.  It's right here. _He flips up the tablecloth at the next table, revealing the camera pointed at Martin and Daphne's table.  They blanche._

speaker: Ed
text: I decided to go undercover.  I wanted to get people just being themselves.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh well, we were really boring, believe me!  Why don't you just rewind it a few minutes and tape over it?

speaker: Ed
text: Funny.  Mrs. Pappas said the same thing.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, why did you and this Crystal break up?  I mean, I'm not meddling, I'm just curious, that's all.

speaker: Nikos
text: It was a career conflict.  She's a juggler, too.  You may have heard of her -- Crystal Baker?

speaker: Frasier
text: No.  I, uh, don't get to street theatre as often as I should.

speaker: Nikos
text: Fabulous performer.  Fabulous girl, for that matter.  But, she wanted to work in Paris and I wanted to stay here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, there's always pressure on the two-career family.

speaker: Nikos
text: We had a big fight about it.  Then Mary-Ann came along. By the time Crystal got back, I was engaged.

speaker: Frasier
text: And how did she take the news?

speaker: Nikos
text: She was crushed.  But she's been wonderful, like she called me a few nights ago to congratulate me.  We talked for hours, just like old times.  She's a sweetheart.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, she's starting to sound like one.

speaker: Nikos
text: Yeah, it was really great talking with her.  I felt happy... purely happy.  Maybe the last time I did.  I mean, since then it's been all the usual pre-wedding stuff.  You know, the jitters, night-sweats, vomiting.

speaker: Frasier
text: Nikos, I promised your mother that I would never again interfere in your life--

speaker: Nikos
text: Interfere?  You saved me from making a terrible mistake! I-I value your advice above anything.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, then.  In the interests of your future happiness, I feel it's my duty to let you know--

speaker: Zora
text: Nikos, please go make your Uncle Stavros to stop dancing on the table.

speaker: Zora
text: Just once it would be nice to have a family gathering where no one leaves in an ambulance, am I right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, wouldn't it?

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Eddie, come on, you've been working ever since I've been here!  You haven't even had a chance to chow down!

speaker: Ed
text: Well, I wouldn't mind grabbing a bite.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, hand me that thing, then.  I know how to run that baby.

speaker: Ed
text: [_hands the camera over_] Be careful, that tape is historic!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh.

speaker: Ed
text: I have interviewed every single living member of the family. I even went out to the retirement home and taped Nikos's great-grandmother -- 101 years old.

speaker: Martin
text: That's amazing. [_Ed leaves_] Wow, 101.  Gosh, that's older than the century.  She probably has got more stories than anybody else has... I can't do this.

speaker: Daphne
text: Think you have to press this button right here.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, thanks.

speaker: Martin
text: Bye! _Daphne puts the lid on the urn.  They slip away.  Zora picks up a wireless microphone._

speaker: Zora
text: OK, everybody, gather round, we're going to have some toasts here!  So, if everybody will stop what they're doing for just one minute and come closer... _As Zora speaks, Frasier notices Niles peering out through the porthole in the kitchen door.  He goes into the kitchen._

speaker: Frasier
text: For God's sake, Niles, why don't you just hide in the men's room?

speaker: Niles
text: Where do you think Yvonne is right now? [_checks out window_] Where have you been?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I've been on the phone.  I've been trying to contact Nikos's ex-girlfriend.

speaker: Niles
text: The depths you'll sink to to get a date.

speaker: Frasier
text: I am convinced that he's still in love with her, and she with him!  I thought if I could get the two of them together he might realize it in time.  Niles, I couldn't reach her, she's out working tonight.  I had to leave a message with her roommate.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, perhaps the time has come for you to--

speaker: Yvonne
text: Hi.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Yvonne.

speaker: Niles
text: -stop playing games and start being direct!

speaker: Zora
text: [_o.s._] Frasier?  Where's Frasier Crane?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear God. _He goes out into the dining room.  Niles follows him and sits down. All the guests are seated.  Nikos and Mary-Ann stand together in the middle, with Zora hovering around them._

speaker: Zora
text: Ah, there you are!  Come up here and make a toast to the happy couple!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, all right, I guess a thought or two comes to mind. [_takes the microphone_] Well, I've known Nikos all his life, and I'm sure that he realizes marriage is a binding commitment, not to be entered into hastily--

speaker: Zora
text: [_sensing trouble_] But when the right one comes along, you know it!  Hmm?

speaker: Frasier
text: And that it's very important to-to find the person that you're most compatible with.  The one who makes you feel happy... purely happy.

speaker: Zora
text: More important, makes me feel happy, eh?

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course, it would be a shame to go through life having to say, "if I'd only waited..."

speaker: Zora
text: Hey, what the hell kind of toast is this, anyway?!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_getting his last shot in_] I just want to make sure that my cousin marries the woman that he truly loves the most.

speaker: Zora
text: Oh, well, there!  Cheers, everybody! [_takes the microphone_] Oh, thank you, Frasier.  If I may say a word or two?  My son Nikos and I have had our ups and downs, but tonight, at this moment, I can honestly say... what the hell are you doing here?! _Crystal -- a short, dark-haired girl still wearing a clown costume and folie makeup painted on her face -- has just entered. _

speaker: Nikos
text: Crystal!

speaker: Crystal
text: Nikos!  I couldn't let you get married without... without letting you know that I-I... _She can't find the words.  Instead, she grabs some long breadsticks and tosses one to Nikos.  He picks up two more, and they start relay- juggling them._

speaker: Zora
text: Nikos, what are you doing?  Stop it!

speaker: Niles
text: [_aside_] How did she get the message?

speaker: Frasier
text: Her roommate must have reached her on her car phone!

speaker: Niles
text: Jugglers have car phones?

speaker: Zora
text: Nikos, you are ruining everything! [_to Crystal_] You, shoo, shoo, shoo!

speaker: Mary-Ann
text: Nikos!  Nikos!

speaker: Nikos
text: I'm sorry, Mary-Ann, but Crystal's the one I'm meant to be with.

speaker: Mary-Ann
text: I will never forgive you for this!

speaker: Mary-Ann
text: Oh, see how happy you've made my parents?!

speaker: Zora
text: Frasier, he's lost his mind!  Talk to him, he listens to you!

speaker: Frasier
text: You remember my promise, no more meddling!

speaker: Nikos
text: Excuse me, everyone.  This may not exactly be appropriate, but I have a toast too.  To the man who reunited me with the woman I plan to spend my life with--

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, inappropriate!  Toast time is over!

speaker: Nikos
text: But we want to offer you our thanks--

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no, no.  You know what, everyone, why don't we do some bouzouki dancing? _He breaks into a feverish routine that makes me hysterical every time I watch it - rapping out "Ya-da-da-da!'s" while dancing the way a marionette version of Zorba the Greek might._

speaker: Zora
text: Why are they thanking you?

speaker: Crystal
text: We owe our happiness to him.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_headed for the gallows_] Why couldn't she have been a mime?

speaker: Nikos
text: Once again, he saved me from making a terrible mistake. So, everyone, please lift your glasses to my cousin, Frasier Crane!

speaker: Zora
text: Oh, I can do better than a glass!

speaker: Frasier
text: No!  Aunt Zora, no!  Out of my way! _He flees into the kitchen, with Zora right after him.  As the noise grows, Niles and Daphne calmly get up and head out.  Martin and Walt shake hands._

speaker: Martin
text: Well, Walt...

speaker: Walt
text: Marty...

speaker: Martin
text: Goodbye again. _He limps out of the restaurant.  Nikos and Crystal kiss, the musicians play, the dancers dance, and the party goes on as the sounds of crashes and Frasier's screams for mercy continue from the kitchen._
